greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) = C_n(k) where C_n(k) = number of k-colored labeled graphs with n nodes (n >= 1, 1<=k<=n).
comment: A coloring of a simple graph G is a choice of color for each graph vertex such that no two vertices sharing the same edge have the same color.

Let E(x) = sum_{n >= 0} x^n/(n!*2^C(n,2)) = 1 + x + x^2/(2*2!) + x^3/(2^3*3!) + .... Read has shown that (E(x) - 1)^k is a generating function for labeled graphs on n nodes that can be colored using exactly k colors. Cases include A213441 (k = 2), A213442 (k = 3) and A224068 (k = 4).

In this triangle, colorings of a labeled graph using k colors that differ only by a permutation of the k colors are treated as the same giving 1/k!*(E(x) - 1)^k as a generating function function for the k-th column. (End)
reference: F. Harary and E. M. Palmer, Graphical Enumeration, Academic Press, NY, 1973, p. 18, Table 1.5.1.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275
R. C. Read, The number of k-colored graphs on labelled nodes, Canad. J. Math., 12 (1960), 410-414.
formula: A generating function for column k: 1/k!*(E(x) - 1)^k = sum {n>=k} T(n,k)x^n/(n!*2^C(n,2)).
The row polynomials R(n,x) satisfy the recurrence equation R(n,x) = x*(1 + sum {k = 0..n-1} binomial(n-1,k)*2^(k*(n-k))*R(k,x)) with R(1,x) = x. The row polynomials appear to have only real zeros.
maple: for p from 1 to 20 do C[p,1] := 1; od: for k from 2 to 20 do for p from 1 to k-1 do C[p,k] := 0; od: od: for k from 2 to 10 do for p from k to 10 do C[p,k] := add( binomial(p,n)*2^(n*(p-n))*C[n,k-1]/k,n=1..p-1); od: od:
mathematica: maxn = 8; t[_, 1] = 1; t[n_, k_] := t[n, k] = Sum[ Binomial[n, j]*2^(j*(n - j))*t[j, k - 1]/k, {j, 1, n - 1}]; Flatten[ Table[t[n, k], {n, 1, maxn}, {k, 1, n}]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 21 2011 *)
program: (PARI) T(n,k)={n!*2^binomial(n,2)*polcoef((sum(j=1, n, x^j/(j!*2^binomial(j,2))) + O(x*x^n))^k, n)/k!} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Nov 30 2018
xref: Apart from scaling, same as A058875.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 07 2001
